chapter.title: Identifiers
chapter.para: Identifiers model the primary key of an entity. They are used to uniquely identify each specific entity. Every entity must define an identifier.

note.para: Technically the identifier does not have to map to the column(s) physically defined as the entity table's primary key. They just need to map to column(s) that uniquely identify each row. However this documentation will continue to use the terms identifier and primary key interchangeably.

chapter.para: An identifier might be simple (single value) or composite (multiple values).
